action.content:
You are participating in a collaborative guessing game.
The goal is to find out whether this grid and another picture only I can see, are the same.
Please describe your grid first. Then, I will provide my description and we can ask each other questions about the grids to figure out whether they are the same. Now start your short grid description with "DESCRIPTION:" followed by the description. Do not add anything else. This is your grid:
X ▢ ▢ ▢ ▢
X ▢ ▢ ▢ ▢
X ▢ ▢ ▢ ▢
X ▢ ▢ ▢ ▢
X X X X X
DESCRIPTION: A 5x5 grid with filled squares in the entire first column and the entire bottom row, with all other squares empty.

You are participating in a collaborative guessing game.
The goal is to find out whether this grid and another picture only I can see, are the same.
Please describe your grid first. Then, I will provide my description and we can ask each other questions about the grids to figure out whether they are the same. Now start your short grid description with "DESCRIPTION:" followed by the description. Do not add anything else. This is your grid:
X ▢ ▢ ▢ ▢
X ▢ ▢ ▢ ▢
X X X ▢ ▢
X ▢ ▢ ▢ ▢
X X X X X

DESCRIPTION: A 5x5 grid where the first row has an X in the first cell and the remaining four cells are empty; the second row is identical to the first; the third row has Xs in the first three cells followed by two empty cells; the fourth row has an X in the first cell and four empties; and the fifth row is completely filled with Xs.

This is my DESCRIPTION: A 5x5 grid with filled squares in the entire first column and the entire bottom row, with all other squares empty.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my grid that may be different to your grid. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Does your grid have any filled squares outside of the first column and the bottom row?

This is my DESCRIPTION: A 5x5 grid where the first row has an X in the first cell and the remaining four cells are empty; the second row is identical to the first; the third row has Xs in the first three cells followed by two empty cells; the fourth row has an X in the first cell and four empties; and the fifth row is completely filled with Xs.
QUESTION: Does your grid have any filled squares outside of the first column and the bottom row? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my grid that may be different to your grid. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: In any row besides the bottom row, are there filled squares in columns other than the first?

ANSWER: No
QUESTION: In any row besides the bottom row, are there filled squares in columns other than the first? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my grid that may be different to your grid. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: In any row other than the bottom row, do you have more than one filled square?

ANSWER: Yes
QUESTION: In any row other than the bottom row, do you have more than one filled square? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my grid that may be different to your grid. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: In any row besides the bottom row, if there is more than one filled square, are those filled squares adjacent to each other?

ANSWER: No
QUESTION: In any row besides the bottom row, if there is more than one filled square, are those filled squares adjacent to each other? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my grid that may be different to your grid. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Do all rows except the bottom row in your grid contain exactly one filled square?

ANSWER: Yes
QUESTION: Do all rows except the bottom row in your grid contain exactly one filled square? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my grid that may be different to your grid. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: In your grid, is the only row besides the bottom row that contains more than one filled square the third row?

ANSWER: Yes
QUESTION: In your grid, is the only row besides the bottom row that contains more than one filled square the third row? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.

Now come to a decision. What do you think: are your grid and the other grid described the same?  Write "DECISION: same grid" if you think they are the same grid or "DECISION: different grids" if you think they are different grids. Do not add anything else.

ANSWER: Yes
